name: PostCustomer
description:
Create a customer without a predefined ID.
The customer's primary address
will be used as the default address for payment
instruments, subscriptions and invoices if none
are provided.

If you wish to create the customer with a predefined
ID (which we recommend to prevent duplication), you
may use our `PUT` request described below.

Read our guide to [preventing duplicates](https://api-guides.rebilly.com/core-concepts/preventing-duplicates)
to understand more.

Organization-Id.description: Organization identifier in scope of which need to perform request (if not specified, the default organization will be used).

$ul: **_embedded**: Any embedded objects available that are requested by the `expand` querystring parameter.
**amount**: Average approved payment amount in Merchant's reporting currency.
**amountUsd**: Average approved payment amount in USD.

**customFields**: Custom Fields list as a map `{"custom field name": "custom field value", ...}`. The format must follow the saved format (see Custom Fields section for the formats). (default: [object Object])
**invoiceCount**: An auto-incrementing number based on the sequence of invoices. If set to 0, then this record is a Lead, otherwise is a Customer.
**lastPaymentTime**: The most recent time of an approved payment for the customer.
**amount**: Revenue amount in Merchant's reporting currency.
**paymentCount**: The number of approved payments for the customer.

**country**: The contact country ISO Alpha-2 code.
**hash**: A hash that can be used to compare multiple contacts for identical attribute values.
